atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind's base, components, and utilities styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use @apply to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @responsive
atDirectives.description: You can generate responsive variants of your own classes by wrapping their definitions in the @responsive directive.

atDirectives.name: @screen
atDirectives.description: The @screen directive allows you to create media queries that reference your breakpoints by name instead of duplicating their values in your own CSS.

atDirectives.name: @variants
atDirectives.description: Generate hover, focus, active and other variants of your own utilities by wrapping their definitions in the @variants directive.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the @layer directive to tell Tailwind which 'bucket' a set of custom styles belong to.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the @theme directive to access your Tailwind config values using dot notation.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Define custom variants for Tailwind CSS.
